name: Joseph Wang
title: Markets Weekly January 25, 2025
text:
Synopsis
The Trump administration is pursuing an aggressive economic strategy focused on attracting business investment, reducing regulations, and challenging international trade dynamics, particularly with China, which has accumulated a massive $1 trillion trade surplus through state-controlled industrial policies.

Key Insights
- Trump administration signed executive orders aimed at reducing business regulations and attracting foreign investment
- Proposed tariffs: 25% on Canada and Mexico, 10% on China, starting February 1st
- Seeking to encourage businesses to build in America through regulatory relief and potential tax incentives
- Openness to skilled immigration, potentially to attract global talent
- China recorded a $1 trillion trade surplus, maintained through state-controlled currency and industrial policies
- Chinese government manipulating trade statistics to minimize perceived trade surplus
- Bank of Japan raised interest rates, with inflation forecast increased to 2.5% for 2025
- Potential for continued interest rate hikes in Japan, diverging from global rate cut expectations
- Trump administration showing interest in strategic territorial expansion, including potential interest in Greenland
- Targeting energy cost reduction through drilling encouragement and withdrawal from Paris Climate Accord
